title: (x) 'Burns & Cotter': Serif Font... seems familiar, just can't place it - University Roman {Nick C, Riccardo}
content:
I am trying to place main font in this image. It seems familiar, but I can't figure it out! Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [logo B&C Ins.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202140025/http:/typophile.com/files/logo%20B&C%20Ins.jpg) | 150.11 KB |
author: audgelane

comments.content: Close. I thought that might be it too, but it wasn't.

It is University Roman. It has been squooshed a bit.  
The swashy end ‘r’ can be found in the [Letraset version](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202140025/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/university-roman/regular/characters.html).  
The differences in ‘B’ and ‘t’ might be due to the fact that this is a pre-digital version.  
F

The Tilde version has the B:  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/tilde/univrsty-roman/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202140025/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/tilde/univrsty-roman/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/tilde/univrsty-roman/")

Also, the t could be constructed with the stem of other letters. Or be from here:  
 [http://www.typophile.com/node/2833#comment-22665](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202140025/http:/www.typophile.com/node/2833#comment-22665 "http://www.typophile.com/node/2833#comment-22665")
